title: Zanab247
author: Zanab247
content: Hello my fellow Naija people, I bring dis topic so that people planning to invest in BTC will know d one that will benefit them either long holding or short holding, because what is good for Mr A it may not good for Mr B based on their believe and strength of holding. Both long holders and short holders are profitable in their investment but long term holders are more profitable than short term holding, which I have witnessed from some potential investors in d community. Long holding require patience and faith before you can succeed from your investment which those investors planing to upgrade from short holding to long holding to ensure they apply patience and faith whenever there is a bear season. Short holders too make a profits from their investment but is not big like d one long term holders are making, because it doesn't need long holding before you can earn from your investment at the moment. If I may ask about long term holders and short term holders, who profit most?  I believe there are some people here who have never experience long term holding but dey want to swatch, what will be your advice to them? Your opinion is welcome.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: The major thing is that capital of your investment. When you are investing for short term and your capital is huge and after the investment for about two weeks, bitcoin price enter $100,000 and dat means you will make a very big profit and when you dey invest for a long term with very small amount of bitcoin even 10 years the profit will not bog. So the capital of the investment determine the profit u will make.

Long-term investments highlight the importance of time over finance. Although your chances of success are slimmer, your short-term investment goals may be sound. When you invest over time, you not only get to keep your winnings, but you also have time to fix any financial mistakes you may have made. It is preferable to invest over a long period of time, such as three to four years.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: I agree with you that long time holding is good and highly profitable. It also save you the stress and time of checking your portfolio every now and then. The only area I have also noticed is that, for a market that is consolidating like we have now, short term traders make so much profit buying and selling in a range. By the time they do this repeatedly, they would have made much more profits than those holding for long. But this require so much experience and discipline. Las Las, it boils down to what you are comfortable with and whatever suit your risk appetite.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: According to the saying, Bitcoin investment is not a get-rich-quick scheme; normally, it takes time for the bull market to come, and it's obvious that only during the bull market are more profits likely attainable, but some investors usually don't have the patience to hold their coins for a longer time, and the profit they can make for the time they have held will not really be huge. I think it's better to hold Bitcoin for the long term than to sell it so soon. Holding for the long term is not so difficult, but it only becomes difficult if the investor is only putting all their hope on that Bitcoin investment. Perhaps if you have some other business or a job that pays you regularly, you would not really have the need to sell your asset so quickly.

comments.author: Bebe22
comments.body: Determining whether long-term or short-term holders earn more from Bitcoin depends on several factors. As you said, "What is good for Mr. A, may not be good for Mr. B". Long-term holders who are generally focused on the potential growth of Bitcoin over an extended period, keep their Bitcoin over time with the ambition to benefit from the overall upward trajectory of the cryptocurrency. Long-term holders typically believe in the long-term viability and potential of Bitcoin and are willing to endure short-term price fluctuations. They may benefit from capital gains if the price of Bitcoin increases significantly over time Short-term traders, on the other hand, aim to profit from short-term price movements. They actively monitor market trends, use technical analysis, and employ trading strategies to capitalize on price volatility. It's worth commenting that both approaches have their advantages and disadvantages, and no strategy guarantees consistent gains. Ultimately, the decision between long-term and short-term holding strategy depends on your investment goals and personal preferences. Personally, I'd go for both (although, I'm not that strong in Bitcoin), I think I'd want short-term investments in Altcoins, and then long-term investments in Bitcoin.
